parameters.definition: Number of bananas a small crate can hold
Number of bananas a large crate can hold
Minimum ratio of large crates to small crates

description: A banana company sells their bananas in small and large crates. A small crate can hold \param{BananasPerSmallCrate} bananas while a large crate can hold \param{BananasPerLargeCrate} bananas. Since large crates are more manageable, the number of large crates must be at least \param{MinLargeToSmallRatio} times the number of small crates. However, at least \param{MinSmallCrates} small crates should be used. If the company has available \param{TotalBananas} bananas, how many of each crate should the company use to maximize the total number of crates produced?
